bibl.seg: Ruffini Giovanni, Village Life and Family Power in Late Antique Nessana. Avec résumé en anglais.

The driving engine of social change in late antique Nessana was competition between distinct local families, linked between each other by social connections. This localizing model of family power challenges the standard models of provincial economy and society in the late antique East, which imagine a world of great estates and powerful aristocrats.
